pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with the Secretary-General of the United Nations, António Guterres | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke today with the Secretary-General of the United Nations, António Guterres, to offer his condolences for the many United Nations staff who lost their lives in the Ethiopian Airlines crash. Secretary-General Guterres also offered his condolences to the Prime Minister for the loss of Canadian lives.

The Prime Minister and the Secretary-General discussed the senseless terrorist attack in Christchurch, New Zealand. Prime Minister Trudeau reaffirmed Canada’s commitment to working domestically and internationally to combat hatred, intolerance, Islamophobia, and terrorism. The Prime Minister and the Secretary-General agreed to work together on this shared priority.

They concluded by welcoming the close cooperation between Canada and the United Nations on key global challenges such as climate change and gender equality, and looked forward to their ongoing collaboration.
